title.narrative: Interquorum Network: Youth Volunteering for Rural Development

description.narrative: This project focuses on youth and rural poverty, seeking to understand its causes by critically analyzing the prevailing development model, social inequities, unequal distribution of resources, and the disenchantment of youth with political participation nation-wide. This project will also work on overcoming poverty, by addressing some of its root causes, such as the deficient educational level, which prevents them from sustainably tapping their potential to improve their quality of life. The project aims to build young men’s and women’s capacities. When they are organized, they can promote actions for social change, involve rural youth in order to promote sustainable rural development, and contribute to narrowing the existing gap discriminating against stakeholders in both rural and urban areas; thus generating a democratic, participatory, efficient organizational culture. The 2,500 original youth and 6,000 pass ons will take part in reflection and debate, and through meetings, experience exchanges, training, and advocacy campaigns, among other activities, will exercise active citizenship to reinforce their social fabric in their daily lives, taking attitudes that are coherent with their principles and creatively strengthening democracy. The project will also build alliances with local grassroots organizations and institutions, taking part in training and outreach activities to strengthen their leadership and empowerment locally and regionally.
